solution.text:
Given that:\(_{l}_tan_{j}_\times tan_{k}_\times tan_{{90-j}}_\times tan_{{90-k}}_\)
solving given equation
we can write : tan_{j}_ as cot(90-_{j}_)
similarly
tan_{k}_ as cot(90-_{k}_)
which gives :
Now the equation can be written as :\(_{l}_cot_{{90-j}}_\times cot_{{90-k}}_\times tan_{{90-j}}_\times tan_{{90-k}}_\)
since, we know that :
cot(X) = \(1 \over tan(X) \)
using this identity we can write the equation as follows :
_{l}_\(1 \over tan(_{{90-j}}_) \)\(\times \)\(1 \over tan(_{{90-k}}_) \)\(\times \)tan(_{{90-j}}_)\(\times \)tan(_{{90-k}}_)
which is equal to _{l}_

content.text:
Evaluate the value of given equation:
\(_{l}_tan_{j}_\times tan_{k}_\times tan_{{90-j}}_\times tan_{{90-k}}_\)
